Interface Scope

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Block, Klass, Method

    public interface Scope
    An interface for defining scopes and scoping rules for Minijava.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void define(Symbol sym)
      Define a symbol in the current scope
      static Klass getEnclosingKlass(Scope scope) 
      static Method getEnclosingMethod(Scope scope)

      Where to look next for symbols;
      java.util.Set<Symbol> getInitializedVariables() 
      java.lang.String getScopeName() 
      boolean hasBeenInitialized(java.lang.String name) 
      void initialize(Symbol sym)
      Adds sym to a collection of initialied variables in this scope.
      Symbol lookup(java.lang.String name)
      Searches for the symbol in the scope.

      Searches for the symbol in the current scope.

    • Method Detail

      • getScopeName

        java.lang.String getScopeName()
        Returns:
        the name of this scope.

      • getEnclosingScope

        Scope getEnclosingScope()
        Where to look next for symbols;
        Returns:
        the scope that contains this scope.

      • define

        void define(Symbol sym)
        Define a symbol in the current scope
        Parameters:
        sym - A symbol to be defined in this scope.

      • initialize

        void initialize(Symbol sym)
        Adds sym to a collection of initialied variables in this scope.
        Parameters:
        sym - The symbol to be initialized

      • lookup

        Symbol lookup(java.lang.String name)
        Searches for the symbol in the scope. If this scope does not contain a symbol with the symbolName, name, return getEnclosingScope==null ? null : getEnclosingScope().lookup(name);
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the symbol that you would like to lookup
        Returns:
        the symbol that is being referenced, or null if it is not in the symbol-table

      • lookupLocally

        Symbol lookupLocally(java.lang.String name)
        Searches for the symbol in the current scope. If this scope does not contain a symbol with the symbolName name, return null;
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the symbol that you would like to lookup
        Returns:
        the symbol that is being referenced, or null if it is not in the current scope.

      • hasBeenInitialized

        boolean hasBeenInitialized(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the symbol that may or may not have been initialized
        Returns:
        true if the symbol with the given name has been initialized and false otherwise.

      • getInitializedVariables

        java.util.Set<Symbol> getInitializedVariables()
        Returns:
        a set of all of the initialized variables in the this scope.

      • getEnclosingKlass

        static Klass getEnclosingKlass(Scope scope)
        Parameters:
        scope - A Scope for which you want to know the Klass that contains it.
        Returns:
        the Klass that contains scope. If a Method m is overwritten in a subclass, getEnclosingKlass(m) returns the subclass

      • getEnclosingMethod

        static Method getEnclosingMethod(Scope scope)
        Parameters:
        scope - A scope for which you want to know the Method that contains it.
        Returns:
        the Method that contains scope.
